001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Entity;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.AffineTransformation;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.NeuronFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.TrainableScalarFunction;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.ActivationFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.Activations;
011
012import java.util.List;
013
014/**
015 * Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.
016 * <p>
017 * A {@code Neuron} receives inputs from other neurons, computes a weighted sum with a bias
018 * (the pre-activation or "logit"), and applies an {@link ActivationFunction} to produce its output.
019 * The neuron caches its most recent activation so repeated reads are cheap until explicitly
020 * {@linkplain #deactivate() deactivated}.
021 *
022 * <h2>Computation</h2>
023 * For inputs {@code x₁ … xₙ}, weights {@code w₁ … wₙ}, and bias {@code b}:
024 * <pre>
025 *   logit  = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
026 *   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)
027 * </pre>
028 *
029 * <h2>Lifecycle</h2>
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li>Before activation, no valid output is available.</li>
032 *   <li>{@link #activate()} pulls inputs from upstream neurons, computes and caches the output.</li>
033 *   <li>{@link #deactivate()} clears the activation state so the neuron can be evaluated again.</li>
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * <h2>Thread-safety</h2>
037 * <ul>
038 *   <li>{@link #activate()} and {@link #deactivate()} are {@code synchronized} to avoid races.</li>
039 *   <li>Weight/bias mutation is not synchronized; coordinate externally if used concurrently.</li>
040 * </ul>
041 */
042@DomainObject
043@Entity
044public class Neuron implements TrainableScalarFunction<Float> {
045
046    public static Neuron create(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes) {
047        return create(name, inputNodes, Activations.linear());
048    }
049
050    public static Neuron create(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
051        return new Neuron(name, inputNodes, new NeuronFunction(AffineTransformation.create(inputNodes.size(), JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT), activationFunction));
052    }
053
054    private final String name;
055    private final List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes;
056    private final NeuronFunction neuronFunction;
057    private final Float[] inputValues;
058    private float output;
059    private boolean activated;
060
061    /**
062     * Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.
063     * <p>
064     * The parameter vector is sized as {@code inputs.size() + 1} where index {@code 0} is the bias
065     * and indices {@code 1..} are the weights corresponding to the {@code inputNodes} order.
066     *
067     * @param name           human-readable identifier for the neuron
068     * @param inputNodes     upstream input neurons in positional order; may be {@code null} for no inputs
069     * @param neuronFunction the neuron function to compute a forward signal
070     */
071    public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes, NeuronFunction neuronFunction) {
072        this.name = name;
073        this.inputNodes = inputNodes == null ? List.of() : inputNodes;
074        this.inputValues = new Float[inputNodes == null ? 0 : inputNodes.size()];
075        this.neuronFunction = neuronFunction;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Returns the neuron name.
080     *
081     * @return the human-readable identifier
082     */
083    public String getName() {
084        return name;
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Returns the upstream input neurons feeding this neuron.
089     *
090     * @return an immutable list (possibly empty) of input neurons
091     */
092    public List<? extends Neuron> getInputNodes() {
093        return inputNodes;
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Returns the neuron function.
098     *
099     * @return the neuron function
100     */
101    public NeuronFunction getNeuronFunction() {
102        return neuronFunction;
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Returns the cached input values used during the most recent {@link #activate()}.
107     *
108     * @return a snapshot array of input values corresponding to {@link #getInputNodes()}
109     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
110     */
111    public Float[] getInputValues() {
112        if (!isActivated()) {
113            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
114        }
115        return inputValues;
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Computes and caches this neuron's output by:
120     * <ol>
121     *   <li>Reading outputs from {@link #getInputNodes()} into an internal buffer,</li>
122     *   <li>Applying the {@link #getNeuronFunction()} ()}.</li>
123     * </ol>
124     * Subsequent calls are no-ops until {@link #deactivate()} is invoked.
125     */
126    public synchronized void activate() {
127        if (neuronFunction == null || neuronFunction.getParameterCount() == 0) {
128            activated = true;
129            return;
130        }
131        if (isActivated()) {
132            return;
133        }
134        for (int d = 1; d <= neuronFunction.arity(); d++) {
135            inputValues[d - 1] = getInputNodes().get(d - 1).getOutput();
136        }
137        output = neuronFunction.estimateScalar(inputValues);
138        activated = true;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Indicates whether this neuron has a cached activation result.
143     *
144     * @return {@code true} if {@link #activate()} has been called and not yet {@link #deactivate()}ed; otherwise {@code false}
145     */
146    public boolean isActivated() {
147        return activated;
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.
152     */
153    public synchronized void deactivate() {
154        activated = false;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
159     *
160     * @return the activated output value
161     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
162     */
163    public float getOutput() {
164        if (!isActivated()) {
165            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
166        }
167        return output;
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
172     *
173     * @param source the input neuron
174     * @return the corresponding weight, or {@code null} if not found
175     */
176    public Float getWeight(Neuron source) {
177        for (int d = 1; d <= inputNodes.size(); d++) {
178            if (inputNodes.get(d - 1) == source) {
179                return neuronFunction.getParameter(d);
180            }
181        }
182        return null;
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * {@inheritDoc}
187     */
188    @Override
189    public String toString() {
190        return name + "{" + activated + ", " + output + "}-" + neuronFunction.toString();
191    }
192
193    @Override
194    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<Float> getCurrentNumberType() {
195        return JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT;
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * {@inheritDoc}
200     */
201    @Override
202    public int arity() {
203        return neuronFunction.arity();
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * {@inheritDoc}
208     */
209    @Override
210    public Float estimateScalar(Float[] inputs) {
211        return neuronFunction.estimateScalar(inputs);
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * {@inheritDoc}
216     */
217    @Override
218    public Float[] calculateParameterGradients(Float[] inputs) {
219        return neuronFunction.calculateParameterGradients(inputs);
220    }
221
222    /**
223     * {@inheritDoc}
224     */
225    @Override
226    public int getParameterCount() {
227        return neuronFunction.getParameterCount();
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * {@inheritDoc}
232     */
233    @Override
234    public Float[] getParameters() {
235        return neuronFunction.getParameters();
236    }
237
238    /**
239     * {@inheritDoc}
240     */
241    @Override
242    public Float getParameter(int p) {
243        return neuronFunction.getParameter(p);
244    }
245
246    /**
247     * {@inheritDoc}
248     */
249    @Override
250    public void setParameters(Float[] values) {
251        neuronFunction.setParameters(values);
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * {@inheritDoc}
256     */
257    @Override
258    public void setParameter(int p, Float value) {
259        neuronFunction.setParameter(p, value);
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * {@inheritDoc}
264     */
265    @Override
266    public void adjustParameters(Float[] deltas) {
267        neuronFunction.adjustParameters(deltas);
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * {@inheritDoc}
272     */
273    @Override
274    public void adjustParameter(int p, Float delta) {
275        neuronFunction.adjustParameter(p, delta);
276    }
277}
